that's the beauty of being a
concentrator eleonora nog works at the
whitney museum of american art she
specializes in repairing modern and
contemporary pieces like paul text
untitled which went on exhibit last week
this was one of the most challenging
pieces in the current exhibition it was
quite seriously broken we were afraid
even to handle it before nog who is
originally from hungry could restore the

urethane and day glow paint the
challenge comes really with modern and

what they use for at it can be anything
today Nog's current project is restoring
alexander calder's circus so this is a
two figures from Alexander Calder circus
it's called the two acrobats made during
the early 20th century the entire piece
consists of more than 200 wire figures
used to create a two-hour circus
performance me realize that the circus
was a performance piece if that was the
essence of this artwork that's what we
have to preserve but to preserve the art
nog needs to understand how Calder
performed it she relies on old photos
and films but none give a complete
picture so she builds replicas to
understand how they work he starts to go
down and after that the music starts
again but a different music nog says
whether she's working on bees wax or
